GPStream PGPS/SAGPS API Library Documentation

Acronyms
ALAbstraction Layer. Static callback functions that are called by SAGPS to store and retrieve data from a target's local data store.
AGPSAssisted GPS
APIApplication Programmers Interface
BCEBroadCast Ephemeris.
CLChipset Library. The Rx Networks chipset library provides a common interface to support a variety of standard chipsets operations. This library shields the user from all chipset specific messaging and/or API calls as required by GPStream products.
CILChipset Interface Layer. Code which contains logic to drive the CL. It includes all chipset-specific logic elements that collect BCE data and inject EE data through the CL.
EEExtended Ephemeris.
EVKEvaluation Kit consisting of Evaluation System executable software, and supporting documentation. Customers can use the EVK to evaluate GPStream™ products, perform prototype integrations, and demonstrate prototype systems to their end customers.
GEELGenerate Extended Ephemeris Layer. Code that handles EE generation.
GPSGlobal Positioning System
GNSSGlobal Navigation Satellite System
IODEIssue of Data Ephemeris
IPInternet Protocol
LCSLocation Services
NVNon-Volatile
PRNPseudo Random Number. Synonymous with SV within this document.
RILRadio Interface Layer, a Microsoft term describing the driver code that abstracts radio chipsets and supports a standardized interface that is utilized within Windows Mobile.
SAGPS™Self-Assisted GPS
SDKSoftware Development Kit. Consists of a GPStream™ library; abstraction layer; integration example; and a complete documentation set.
SVSatellite Vehicle. Synonymous with PRN within this document.
TCPTransmission Control Protocol
TTFFTime To First Fix
URAUser Range Accuracy. Satellite position accuracy is commonly described by a URA index (see IS-GPS-200D).
Note that in the current SAGPS release, URA index values do not match URE values as stipulated within IS-GPS-200 Rev D. For the best indication of EE accuracy, integrators should directly reference URE (see below).
UREUser Range Error. Describes the error associated with satellite position predictions (typically in Meters). See reference IS-GPS-200D for a detailed description of URE.
UTCCoordinated Universal Time.
